titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 244, HONORING INVESTMENTS IN RECRUITING AND EMPLOYING AMERICAN MILITARY VETERANS ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 244, HONORING INVESTMENTS IN RECRUITING AND EMPLOYING AMERICAN MILITARY VETERANS ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 76

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House concurred in the Senate amendments numbered 2 and 3 to H.R. 244, to encourage effective, voluntary investments to recruit, employ, and retain men and women who have served in the United States military with annual Federal awards to employers recognizing such efforts, and concurred in the Senate amendment numbered 1 with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-16 modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-108, by a yea-and-nay vote of 309 yeas to 118 nays, Roll No. 249.<P/>H. Res. 305, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 244) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 186 noes, Roll No. 247, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 192 nays, Roll No. 246.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House concurred in the Senate amendments numbered 2 and 3 to H.R. 244, to encourage effective, voluntary investments to recruit, employ, and retain men and women who have served in the United States military with annual Federal awards to employers recognizing such efforts, and concurred in the Senate amendment numbered 1 with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-16 modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-108, by a yea-and-nay vote of 309 yeas to 118 nays, Roll No. 249.<P/>H. Res. 305, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 244) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 186 noes, Roll No. 247, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 192 nays, Roll No. 246.

extension.searchTitle: DISASTER DECLARATION IMPROVEMENT ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 76

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.

extension.searchTitle: HONORING INVESTMENTS IN RECRUITING AND EMPLOYING AMERICAN MILITARY VETERANS ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 76

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House concurred in the Senate amendments numbered 2 and 3 to H.R. 244, to encourage effective, voluntary investments to recruit, employ, and retain men and women who have served in the United States military with annual Federal awards to employers recognizing such efforts, and concurred in the Senate amendment numbered 1 with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-16 modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-108, by a yea-and-nay vote of 309 yeas to 118 nays, Roll No. 249.

The House concurred in the Senate amendments numbered 2 and 3 to H.R. 244, to encourage effective, voluntary investments to recruit, employ, and retain men and women who have served in the United States military with annual Federal awards to employers recognizing such efforts, and concurred in the Senate amendment numbered 1 with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-16 modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 115-108, by a yea-and-nay vote of 309 yeas to 118 nays, Roll No. 249.<P/>H. Res. 305, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 244) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 240 ayes to 186 noes, Roll No. 247, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 192 nays, Roll No. 246.

titleInfo.title: ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT AMENDMENT

extension.searchTitle: ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT AMENDMENT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 76

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Amending the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act concerning the statute of limitations for actions to recover disaster or emergency assistance payments
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Tuesday, May 2nd.<P/>H.R. 1678, amended, to amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act concerning the statute of limitations for actions to recover disaster or emergency assistance payments, by a \2/3\ recorded vote of 423 ayes with none voting ``no'', Roll No. 250.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Rule Relating to States Savings Arrangements for Non-governmental Employees
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>: By 50 yeas to 49 nays (Vote No. 120), Senate passed H.J. Res. 66, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by States for non-governmental employees.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 119), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.

<P/>: By 50 yeas to 49 nays (Vote No. 120), Senate passed H.J. Res. 66, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by States for non-governmental employees.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 119), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.
